name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As of today, 50% of North Dakota adults have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. We also surpassed 41% of North Dakota adults being fully vaccinated!  Let's keep moving in the right direction, ND!   Help protect yourself and your community:  https://t.co/LDKoK0Kteq  https://t.co/B4iZKUbuHQ

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: HB 1175 provides common-sense protections for North Dakotans who were doing everything they could and will protect businesses, organizations, medical providers and educational providers from frivolous lawsuits arising from COVID-19 exposure.  Full release:  https://t.co/ukKalxHU7e  https://t.co/UUDjtxfx8v

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: On April 30, the COVID-19 emergency declaration will be lifted as we continue to focus our response on our vaccination efforts. We encourage those who haven’t been vaccinated to do so to protect themselves and their communities.  Full release:  https://t.co/SoiQBz7NtW  https://t.co/U9rxuYNGJd

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The Essential Worker Cross-Border Vaccination Initiative will allow Manitoba-based truck drivers to get COVID-19 vaccines in ND, the first such program between Canadian and American jurisdictions. Grateful to Premier @BrianPallister for his efforts and continued friendship. 2/2  https://t.co/p8yJzBNCcx

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has reached another COVID vaccination milestone, with over 250K residents having received at least 1 shot. Grateful to all receiving & giving the vaccine, include at the Fargo center. Thanks to @SanfordHealth’s Tiffany Ahrendt for the tour of this well-run operation!  https://t.co/29E2vnPWMA

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We are up-to-date on our COVID-19 vaccines! Deeply grateful to all of the nurses and @NDNationalGuard members for making this a quick and painless process. Vaccines are available to all citizens 16+ across our great state. Find yours at  https://t.co/LDKoK0Kteq  https://t.co/knA2E5vr2E

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: More than 150,000 North Dakotans have been fully vaccinated from COVID-19, and 39.4% have received at least one dose. We are now in Phase 2, allowing all citizens 16+ access to receive the vaccine. To find a vaccine use the vaccine locator at  https://t.co/LDKoK0Kteq  https://t.co/bXnZBdpUux

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Thank you to @KXMB for hosting our own COO Tammy Miller, @CommerceND Commissioner James Leiman and West River Health Services Dr. Josh Ranum, looking back at one year of COVID-19.   https://t.co/pGGcbwLLfF

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has surpassed more than 300,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccines administered! We have also exceeded 25% of citizens receiving at least one dose of the vaccine. Thank you to all who are giving and receiving these vaccines. Visit  https://t.co/LDKoK0sSmS to find a vaccine.  https://t.co/lsruXYhUjf

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today marks one year since our first case of COVID-19. As we always do in an emergency, North Dakotans came together as friends & neighbors to fight this invisible enemy, taking actions to slow the spread and save lives & livelihoods. Full statement here:  https://t.co/05cFA2GyAW

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to the professional nurses and @NDNationalGuard members helping administer these life-saving vaccines.   Phase 1C includes essential workers for the COVID-19 vaccine and we registered as soon as we were eligible.  https://t.co/NeHhTEJaar

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Congratulations to @aldevron CEO and Carrington, ND native Michael Chambers for a well deserved place among the top 25 Biotech CEOs. Aldevron’s work has accelerated the COVID-19 vaccine delivery, not only in the US but around the world.    https://t.co/aeWMUR4X38

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Flags will be flown at half-staff until sunset Feb. 26 as we grieve the loss of our fellow North Dakotans and Americans to COVID-19. Our hearts and prayers go out to the family and friends who have lost loved ones. Our determination to fight COVID-19 remains stronger than ever.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Economic relief is still available for COVID-impacted hospitality businesses including restaurants, bars, breweries, cafes, movie theaters and event and recreation venues, but the deadline is fast approaching: 5 p.m. CT Thursday, Feb. 25.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Our state reached a major milestone this week: More than 100,000 North Dakotans have now received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine!  Grateful to everyone giving and receiving the vaccine and taking action to slow the spread as our numbers trend in the right direction.  https://t.co/O0Enxb3zSp

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Treatments are FDA-approved for qualified high-risk individuals who test positive for COVID-19 and may prevent hospitalizations. These therapeutics help our bodies fight infection by reducing the amount of virus and may reduce the risk of severe illness.  https://t.co/OQiIjVZ4zF  https://t.co/K44jGPCZoa

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Nearly 30,000 North Dakotans received their first or second dose of COVID-19 vaccine last week, and we continue to rank No. 1 in the nation in percentage of doses received being administered. 1/  https://t.co/c1CRK43GcL

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND has administered more than 105k doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and we continue to lead the nation with 90.6% of received doses being administered. As our active cases drop below 1k, we are grateful for your efforts to slow the spread but we must continue to fight!  https://t.co/ljEJ89VSz4

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Our COVID-19 statewide risk level will be lowered from moderate to low risk, effective 8 a.m. Jan. 29. We are grateful to all citizens, including our medical, education and business communities, for your actions to slow the spread. Details available at  https://t.co/9BNC0IvuOi  https://t.co/vNwzmvP7t3

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has surpassed 60,000 COVID-19 vaccine doses administered and ranks No. 1 in percentage of received doses administered. Thanks to all giving & receiving these safe and effective vaccines to prevent illness & death, end damage to our economy and eradicate the pandemic.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: At 3:00 p.m. we will host a COVID-19 press briefing along with @NDDOH. Watch live at  https://t.co/UOsJh4RStZ.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Friday at 3 p.m. we will hold a press briefing with @NDDOH to provide an update on the COVID-19 pandemic in North Dakota. It will be livestreamed on ND DoH Twitter, Facebook and YouTube channels.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to keynote the @MinneapolisFed Regional Economic Conditions Conference with an update on COVID's economic impact and our opportunity to emerge stronger than ever in ND. Thanks to Fed Pres. @neelkashkari for his leadership and Kathy Neset for her service on the Fed board.  https://t.co/NTmxCsWuQo

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Vaccines are part of our three-pronged attack on COVID-19, along with rapid testing and effective therapeutics that can save lives if administered early. This battle is far from over, but we can see the light at the end of the tunnel, and we've got the tools to get us there. 3/3

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful for the opportunity to join @Microsoft President Brad Smith & @GovHawaii David Ige to discuss broadband availability, data’s role in improving COVID-19 healthcare response & how technology has aided innovation during the pandemic  https://t.co/RUGuCLmew3 @BradSmi @westgov

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Along with vaccines and rapid testing, monoclonal antibody treatments are an essential tool in our fight against COVID-19. Thanks to Dr. Ranum for his insight and education on the use of therapeutics, and to @chrisbergpov for hosting.   https://t.co/gDOhhSq0eu

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Along with vaccines and rapid testing, therapeutics are a key tool in winning the fight against COVID-19. Thanks to Dr. Ranum for raising awareness of this potentially lifesaving treatment!

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We are grateful for all of our frontline workers and their efforts in helping to slow the spread! Vaccines are one of our key tools in protecting North Dakotans from COVID-19. ND ranks 3rd in the nation in people receiving the first dose of the vaccine.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Honored to chair 2021's first meeting of the ND Indian Affairs Commission to discuss COVID-19 response, gaming, cybersecurity, law enforcement & other topics. Thank you tribal chairs, @NDIndianz, @NDDoH & everyone involved for your ongoing collaboration and partnership!  https://t.co/o4Y7V2Y6Ft

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Here in state government, more than 25 agencies came together with a whole-of-government response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The heroes in our state agencies are too many to list, but each one is appreciated and deserving of our gratitude. #NDSOTS21

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Effective 8 a.m. Jan. 8, the COVID-19 statewide risk level will be lowered from high to moderate risk and capacity limits will be increased. We’re grateful to ND citizens and businesses for your continued efforts to slow the spread! Details available at  https://t.co/wcgU4Z3T13  https://t.co/He17XH6p1D

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Effective 8 a.m. tomorrow, bars and restaurants may resume normal hours of operation as COVID-19 active cases and hospitalizations decrease in ND. These businesses are an important part of our economy, and we’re grateful for their efforts and sacrifices to help slow the spread.  https://t.co/98RaTJpj2Z

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As COVID-19 cases continue to trend downward, we’re grateful for your efforts to slow the spread. It's crucial to stay vigilant against the virus, as we’re not in the clear yet. Please stay healthy and stay connected this holiday season.  https://t.co/nHKcdbUGgt

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Along with new vaccines and therapeutics, rapid tests are a key tool in protecting North Dakotans from COVID-19. We look forward to more communities offering rapid tests, which provide results in 15 minutes, to help isolate positives and slow the spread.  https://t.co/ivWjQYVcee

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Congratulations to Shawn for being recognized with the Patriot Award for his outstanding commitment to our valued citizen warriors. We’re grateful to our National Guard and Reserve members who are serving critically important roles in our covid response.   https://t.co/YnlGhrxRE1

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We have 3 new tools to continue our downward COVID trends. While the vaccine is vitally important, we also continue to expand the use of low-cost rapid testing and exciting new therapeutics that have the potential to significantly reduce hospitalizations and save lives.  https://t.co/Wb8ByQzy3r

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: It’s a momentous day in ND as the COVID-19 vaccine arrived less than 72 hours after earning FDA approval! Protecting frontline health care workers and the most vulnerable will save lives and ensure that North Dakotans receive the highest level of care, both COVID & non-COVID.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, with our hospitalizations due to COVID-19 at near-record levels, the mask requirement will be extended to Jan. 18; capacity limits for restaurants, bars and event venues extended to Jan. 8. Winter sports/activities may resume Dec. 14. #MaskUpND  https://t.co/kxw3juPv8G

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Opening tomorrow, the Medical Expense Assistance Program provides another avenue of relief for ND’s first responders and frontline health care workers for COVID-19-related expenses. We're deeply grateful for these workers fighting every day against the coronavirus to save lives.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The remarkable efforts by @NDDOH, @NDNationalGuard, local public health & others have made ND a leader in COVID-19 testing and deserve our deepest gratitude. Our 7-day test positivity ranks 30th. Active cases are down 47% since Nov. 13. But now is not the time to lower our guard.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Deeply grateful to @POTUS for extending the 75% federal cost-share through March for National Guard assistance in our COVID-19 response. The @NDNationalGuard continues to play an essential role in our fight against the pandemic.  https://t.co/evCT9Jgh6w

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The executive budget reflects the support needed for the Department of Health to maintain our pandemic response. We propose $95 million in COVID-related funding, of which $84 million is one-time funding, including $40 million in federal and special funds.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: This week, we're rolling out free rapid COVID-19 testing for K-12 teachers, staff & administrators in 3 school districts as a pilot project that's anticipated to expand.    These tests are a new tool to help us break the chain of transmission. Details:  https://t.co/pQqxkjielx  https://t.co/HvDGiEA47a

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, the Emergency Commission approved $35M in federal funding, including $15M to support medical staffing and nearly $14M to support economic recovery as hospitals and businesses continue to face increasing pressure from the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/RS60dAXq1p

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: With hospitals projecting a surge in COVID-19 patients in the coming weeks, we’re grateful to the @DeptofDefense & @FEMA for sending additional resources & medical personnel to help save lives and alleviate the immense pressure on ND’s health care system.  https://t.co/1jHSRgoJFx

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, ND passed 1 million COVID-19 tests. We’ll continue to pursue an aggressive strategy to identify & isolate positive cases.  Deeply grateful to the State Lab team, partner labs & testing staff who have worked around the clock to slow the spread and protect public health.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We believe in the power of individual responsibility, and we need it now more than ever. Working together – as neighbors, as North Dakotans, as human beings who care deeply for each other – we can slow the spread of COVID-19 and emerge stronger than ever.  https://t.co/IaRhp4HZdj

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As our COVID-19 situation changes, we must change with it. Tonight, we announced four measures designed to reduce the rampant spread of infections in our communities, protect our vulnerable, ensure hospital capacity and keep schools & the economy open.  https://t.co/Chrifpyedh

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As requested by hospitals to address staffing, a State Health Officer order will allow asymptomatic, COVID-positive health care workers to work in the COVID unit of a licensed facility, so long as precautions are taken as recommended by the CDC.  https://t.co/NpObhvZZEh

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Our health care system is under enormous pressure. Hospitalizations due to COVID-19 now account for 14% of current hospitalizations in North Dakota, and hospitals are facing severe constraints in the weeks ahead. We need everyone to help slow the spread.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Bending the curve of COVID-19 requires all of us, as White House Coronavirus Response Coordinator Dr. Deborah Birx said during her visit to ND on Monday and again on @POVnow. 1/2  https://t.co/g5ZGJTYgpO

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Honored to have Dr. Birx back in the state today for an update on ND's COVID response during her tour of the region. She observed that while North Dakota is doing a great job of testing, more people need to wear masks, socially distance & slow the spread.  https://t.co/6UX61yYL2b  https://t.co/WTvnTXVCeG

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota's public lands offer fantastic opportunities to explore our state and take care of your physical and behavioral health during COVID-19. The latest @NDparkrec newsletter has great tips on how you can recreate responsibly! #ndparks  https://t.co/O07fCPJx2X

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: At today's meeting of the Emergency Commission, we approved the reallocation of funding to support ND’s COVID-19 efforts, directing $221M to hospitals, K-12 school districts, cities and counties, the hospitality industry and other businesses and more.  https://t.co/3vU8bp3bFm

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Good discussion w/ city & county leaders about how we can work together to stem the rapid increase of COVID-19 cases. With 1,000+ new cases reported today, everyone needs to take this virus seriously & help slow its spread by wearing masks, distancing & avoiding large gatherings.  https://t.co/QIoZDpDXVg

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND has submitted its COVID-19 vaccination plan to the CDC and we’re ready to take action as soon as a safe and effective vaccine becomes available. Grateful to all who were involved in this collaborative effort to develop a comprehensive plan that will best serve our communities.  https://t.co/ab9KpB64gW

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Had a great call this morning with a dozen mayors from our largest cities regarding efforts to reduce the spread of COVID-19 and discuss upcoming changes in guidance from the state. Tune in to our update with @NDDOH at 3:30 p.m. CT for details.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Though COVID-19 patients make up a small portion of total hospitalizations, it’s important to maintain readiness. Sanford Health’s Dr. Michael LeBeau joined us at this week’s briefing to discuss health care and emphasize the importance of following our public health guidelines.  https://t.co/70HGNKdb0D

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota is now receiving BinaxNOW tests from the federal government, a rapid swab test that will complement existing COVID-19 testing and help protect our most vulnerable. Thanks to the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force for their support of an effective testing strategy.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The amended State Health Officer order issued Wednesday related to quarantining of close contacts of positive COVID-19 cases is being rescinded. Read more here:  https://t.co/iBOnLLjY4g

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, we approved $50M to assist North Dakota businesses struggling due to COVID-19. This unique program through the @BankofND will direct funding to businesses that have been hit the worst to help those who need it most. Applications open soon.  https://t.co/8ZEhnQ5b01

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Every day, we’re grateful to live in a state filled with generous, caring people. On #WorldGratitudeDay, we’re especially grateful for the health care workers, educators, first responders, Team ND members and all who have helped save lives and livelihoods during COVID-19.  https://t.co/LS0SiINPvA

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today's COVID-19 update will begin shortly. Tune in below.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As of today, North Dakota has conducted 500,000+ tests for COVID-19, putting us among the highest in the nation, and we saw our positivity rate below 5% once again. This robust testing allows us to identify and isolate positive cases to protect our most vulnerable populations.  https://t.co/tWhOf3VqSG

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, we updated the COVID-19 risk level for 21 counties in ND, with two goals in mind:  1. Decrease transmissible moments; 2. Highlight the elevated risk that exists and the simple steps North Dakotans can take to slow the spread.  Read more:  https://t.co/zenyV0dntM

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today's COVID-19 update will begin shortly. Watch live below.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: When someone tests positive for COVID-19, we work to identify close contacts to contain the spread of the virus. name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We appreciate @FEMA_Pete for approving ND's participation in the Lost Wages Assistance program created by @POTUS, which will provide immediate relief to North Dakotans whose livelihoods were impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/KfiSTn1w5q   https://t.co/w3vFuzAGIB

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Dr. Deborah Birx has been a valuable partner in the battle against COVID-19. name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The highly skilled team at the @NDDOH State Lab is dedicated to producing high-quality, consistently accurate COVID-19 test results. In this video, Dr. Stahl explains the steps involved in the process. #MaskUpND

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today we announced Care19 Alert, which uses the exposure notification system (ENS) developed by Apple and Google. name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ICYMI: ND was selected as one of four states to work w/ @CDCgov on a pilot project to prepare for the distribution of a COVID-19 vaccine. This is not a vaccine trial, but an opportunity to coordinate with federal, tribal and local health officials on advancing public health.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: In North Dakota, we’re known as a state that takes care of each other. Masks are another way for us to show we care for others & our communities. Join our new #MaskUpND campaign to help raise awareness about how we can take simple steps to fight COVID-19.  https://t.co/wUT0fhuytx  https://t.co/VqAiOYjjrf

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today's COVID-19 briefing will begin shortly. Watch below.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Even when you’re outdoors, give each other some space. Let’s be #NDSmart in the fight against COVID-19.  https://t.co/3BT2bdeKK2

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: .@NDDOH is delivering 2,000 cloth masks to Spirit Lake Nation to help meet PPE needs, and @DakotaMedFdn is sending 1,000 more. We'll continue to work closely with Chairman Doug Yankton and other tribal leaders to ensure adequate supplies & testing to slow the spread of COVID-19.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The @NDUnivSystem is partnering with @NDDOH to encourage students, faculty and staff to get tested for COVID-19 before returning to campus this fall. These free, convenient testing events will be held throughout the month around the state.  https://t.co/YWvD8QrV3I

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As we all face challenges as a result of COVID-19, we need to remember the importance of providing services for our youngest North Dakotans. Here’s a recap of how we’ve worked with child care providers, educators and local leaders throughout this pandemic.  https://t.co/ccpvFFNhAP

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: This week, North Dakota passed a testing milestone. More than 20 percent of our population has now been tested for COVID-19 at least once. Locate a testing site near you:  https://t.co/V7WkgUJQTv  https://t.co/uaoGZXROtp

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Housing stability is a key component of well-being, and the Emergency Rent Bridge program can help North Dakotans experiencing a loss of income due to COVID-19. This short-term rent assistance program is still available to qualified renters:  https://t.co/tAaZH4Kt1O  https://t.co/j6vVa5AJJU

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Be sure to join @CommerceND for tomorrow’s briefing on the Economic Resiliency Grant, which is designed to restore consumer confidence and support businesses in their efforts to slow the spread of COVID-19. Register here:  https://t.co/YqMx1ebFZZ

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Let’s go BIG on fighting COVID-19, North Dakota! Protect your herd, your flock and your community.  You can make a difference: Maintain six feet of distance, wear a mask when appropriate and wash your hands often. #InThisTogetherND  https://t.co/MKiSp2g7yC

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today we announced the formation of the Burleigh-Morton COVID-19 Task Force to focus efforts on slowing the spread in the Bismarck/Mandan metro and surrounding area, which is home to more than one-third of ND's active cases.  https://t.co/JRPSijWFSS

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today's COVID-19 press briefing will begin shortly. Watch live below.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Between Mar. 31-July 24, 1,182 individuals tested positive for COVID-19 after a prior negative test. That’s over 21 percent of our positive cases. This is why serial testing is so important, and we’re committed to continuing to grow ND’s strong COVID-19 testing program.  https://t.co/d0pv8He86M

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: This week's COVID-19 press briefing begins at approximately 3:30 p.m. CT. We'll discuss testing, higher education and business resources. Tune in below!

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Joined @WOYMRadio to discuss ND’s efforts to combat COVID-19 and what it’ll take to beat this pandemic and avoid going backward. It’s up to all of us to follow #NDSmart guidelines: wash your hands, wear a mask when appropriate and stay six feet apart.  https://t.co/mK9vZarXim

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Join us for today's COVID-19 press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT with @NDDPI State Superintendent Kirsten Baesler.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: While our active case numbers in ND continue to climb, our positive test rate remains among the lowest in the nation. tweet: As we approach one of the busiest travel weeks of the year, we all need to remember: the COVID-19 pandemic is not over.  While North Dakota is well-positioned to handle a potential surge in cases, it’s essential we follow #NDSmart guidelines to prevent such a surge. Thread:⤵️

tweet: Join us for this week's COVID-19 press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic is a landmark event in all our lives, and it will have a long-lasting impact on our state budget. This presents a challenge, but we can choose how we respond. Within crisis, there is an opportunity for us to transform.  https://t.co/Rr3Pc9tuxC

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We’ll be live at 3:30 p.m. CT with the latest on COVID-19 in North Dakota. Watch live:  https://t.co/WJTiSYMmg8

name: Gov. Doug Burgum

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Thanks to @marthamaccallum for having me on to discuss the #NDSmartRestart. We’re taking a thoughtful approach to restarting the sectors of North Dakota’s economy that were restricted by executive order due to COVID-19.  https://t.co/4rFRzUFFZd

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Working together, we can continue to manage the risk of COVID-19 to the general public and thoughtfully restart those limited sectors of our economy that were restricted as we fought to slow the spread of COVID-19 and ensure hospital capacity to handle any surge in cases. (3/3)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As ND increases testing capacity, we will find more cases of COVID-19. That's why we look at the rate of positives to accurately assess the spread. Our positive rate is holding steady and beginning to trend downward — an important part of the #NDSmartRestart. (1/3)  https://t.co/bvgK2R64Zu

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Whether you're inside or outdoors enjoying today's spring weather, we ask that you follow state & CDC guidelines to slow the spread of COVID-19. As the number of cases continues to rise, we must continue practicing physical distancing and avoiding gatherings of 10 or more people.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: A rapid response team that conducted testing at the LM Wind Power manufacturing plant in Grand Forks has confirmed 88 cases of COVID-19, with an add'l 22 cases confirmed outside of this testing event. Employees at the plant have been ordered to quarantine.  https://t.co/vE5ZG13iLH

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today’s COVID-19 update will begin at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch live here:  https://t.co/r1oZcFjfJL

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota's rate of positive results from completed tests has been over 7% for three of the last four days. This is still lower than many other states, but it's more important than ever that we continue to follow #NDSmart guidelines to slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/jLULwAH6mc

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Resources for businesses and employers affected by the COVID-19 pandemic can be found at:  https://t.co/9wKOvLwHEv

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: While our hospitalizations remain low and we believe that our health care facilities have the capacity to handle a surge in COVID-19 patients, it's our duty to prepare for the worst-case scenario, and in that regard, ND is well-prepared.  Read the plan:  https://t.co/BLuO4mLIbQ  https://t.co/XwZRoZqcRq

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today’s COVID-19 press briefing will begin at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch here:  https://t.co/fqX9r7zREc

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We continue to fine-tune our hospital surge plan with our health care providers and partners. We're confident we will have the capacity we need should a surge of positive cases occur in ND. As of today less than 1% of our hospital beds are being used for COVID-19 patients. (3/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Working together, we've taken targeted action to slow the spread of COVID-19 in North Dakota so we can avoid having to use a Tier 3 minimum care facility like the Fargodome, where we have pre-positioned beds. (1/4)  https://t.co/p6Xbjif0Mz

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakotans are doing their part to slow the spread of COVID-19 and #FlattenTheCurve. These critical actions are helping us avoid pressure on our health care system and save lives.  Be #NDSmart: stay home, stay healthy, stay connected.  https://t.co/NoBbBawgS9

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s COVID-19 press briefing with the @NDDOH at 3:30 p.m. CT:  https://t.co/5BwlBPMna8

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Just had a great call with our friend and neighbor, Minnesota @GovTimWalz, and we agree: There’s no “us and them,” only “we.” Our states share a river, communities and health care systems, and we’ll continue to work together in the fight against COVID-19. (1/2)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We’ll discuss updates regarding COVID-19 in North Dakota during today’s press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch live:  https://t.co/U7oUu8fRtO

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Every state wants more data on the spread of COVID-19. In ND, we continue to ramp up testing capacity to gain a clearer picture of infection rates. Here's how our testing stacks up.  We're doing well comparatively, but we can always do better and are working every day to improve.  https://t.co/HRr3dX1dC2

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: All around the state, whether in metro centers or rural areas, many of our counties are experiencing similar rates of testing. No matter where you live, your response to COVID-19 should be the same: stay home, stay healthy, stay connected.  https://t.co/gbHh5ft6V4

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to @POTUS and the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force for their support and partnership with governors as we fight this COVID-19 pandemic together!  https://t.co/mHG49LbYx7

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: To protect the most vulnerable and slow the spread, I also signed executive orders requiring self-quarantine for positive cases of COVID-19 & their household members, as well as an executive order suspending visitation to long-term care facilities.  https://t.co/YcaQeDyWiX

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: As ND increases testing capacity, we're seeing among the lowest rates of confirmed positives in the nation with one of the best per capita testing rates.   We'll continue to take targeted action to slow the spread of COVID-19 and preserve hospital capacity to save lives.  https://t.co/oZT8PgVVhX

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT for updates on COVID-19 in North Dakota.  https://t.co/QKy8gLEj36

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: With 409 new tests conducted, North Dakota has confirmed an additional 13 cases of COVID-19.  Remember: stay home, avoid all gatherings and don't go out for non-essential trips. Everyone has a responsibility to help slow the spread.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We're launching a new pilot project to expand COVID-19 testing and improve contact tracing to slow the spread.  This involves setting up drive-through sites this weekend to test as many people as possible in two communities. Read the plan here:  https://t.co/5dIKuEsimG  https://t.co/pK2xKoJ3f6

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today’s press briefing on North Dakota’s COVID-19 response is live at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch here:  https://t.co/YX1xJWh57X

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Donations of personal protective equipment also are being accepted to ensure health care workers and first responders are protected as they respond to COVID-19. Commercially-produced supplies can be dropped off at NDDOT district locations. Details:  https://t.co/76N3r7CTrf

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: If you're in a position to do so, the best way is to donate directly to a trusted, local organization. If they can't accept donations, or if you prefer, you can give to the ND COVID-19 Community & Nonprofit Response Fund at the ND Community Foundation.  https://t.co/vlZkZ5iJsS

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: All North Dakotans should be staying home and avoiding non-essential trips. However, if you need to pick up food and supplies, follow these helpful tips from the North Dakota Grocers Association to stay safe and help slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/vB4AM6T2Th

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s press briefing on COVID-19 at 4 p.m. CT:  https://t.co/H0fZzGjkO9

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND has confirmed 12 new cases of COVID-19, for a cumulative total of 159 confirmed positive cases since the pandemic began.  Be on the lookout for data at 11 am CT going forward. This new, once-daily reporting will allow epidemiologists more time to conduct their investigations.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today, I signed an executive order waiving the mandatory 1-week waiting period for unemployment benefits as claims continue to increase. This is critical to helping out-of-work North Dakotans who are struggling to make ends meet during the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/rccbC7I7lw

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today’s COVID-19 press briefing with the @NDDOH begins at 4 p.m. CT. Watch here:  https://t.co/POwU8kQi6n

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: .@POTUS has granted ND's request for a major presidential disaster declaration, opening up federal assistance for our response efforts. Grateful to the President, his administration & our congressional delegation for their partnership in fighting COVID-19.  https://t.co/epWLxDk9qM

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has confirmed 16 additional cases of COVID-19, with 142 cumulative cases in the state. Stay home, avoid non-essential trips, wash your hands and do not gather in groups of ten or more. Your actions to slow the spread can protect your fellow North Dakotans.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: State agencies have come together to activate the Workforce Coordination Center to serve emergency workforce needs in support of health care providers, industries and agencies affected by COVID-19.   Details:  https://t.co/ogEyMGDxDz

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today’s press briefing on COVID-19 with @SenJohnHoeven and @SenKevinCramer begins at 4 p.m. CT. Watch live:  https://t.co/IxxTM7IvBS

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: It’s with heavy hearts that we announce the second death in ND related to COVID-19. Each loss of life deeply affects that person’s loved ones, and that loss reverberates across each community and the entire state. We all have a role to play in slowing the spread of coronavirus.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND has requested a major presidential disaster declaration to unlock federal assistance to support our response to the COVID-19 pandemic.   This is critical for our capability to expand North Dakota’s response to the rapidly evolving impacts of COVID-19.  https://t.co/uIDDJJjH51

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND saw its largest jump in confirmed cases of COVID-19 today.   Collecting this data is important, and we continue to work to expand our testing capacity. It’s important for North Dakotans to understand this is not a complete picture of the prevalence of COVID-19 in our state.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Tune into today’s briefing on COVID-19 with the @NDDOH at 4 p.m. CT.  https://t.co/kPWbaOoEJm

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has confirmed 15 new cases of COVID-19, for a total of 83 cases.  We know this number will continue to rise. Everyone needs to take steps to slow the spread and #flattenthecurve: stay home, avoid non-essential trips, wash your hands and keep physical distance.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Within the past couple of days, for the first time, ND’s number of confirmed COVID-19 cases attributed to community spread surpassed the number of travel-related or close-contact cases.  It’s everyone’s responsibility to help slow the spread of this virus & protect public health.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s press briefing at 4 p.m. CT for the latest on COVID-19 in North Dakota.  https://t.co/hOPn2JJXwJ

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Sadly, ND has experienced its first death related to COVID-19. Kathryn & I extend our deepest condolences to the family & friends who have lost a loved one. Each of us has a responsibility to help prevent the spread of COVID-19. We’re all in this together.  https://t.co/CNpf9HfZOA

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Access to child care is essential for health, safety and other lifeline workers during the COVID-19 pandemic.   Today we released modified operating practices & an emergency grant program for child care providers to help them through this crisis. Details:  https://t.co/PMVst3gfA5

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s press briefing regarding child care and other updates on the COVID-19 pandemic in North Dakota.  https://t.co/qBpdOCo8dr

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: .@NDDOH confirmed 7 new cases of COVID-19 in ND this morning, increasing the statewide total of confirmed cases to 52.  As of this morning, state & private labs have conducted 2,091 total tests with 2,039 negative results. #COVID19ND  https://t.co/CIduU3WVs8

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND’s first responders and health care workers are on the front lines of the COVID-19 fight.  Today’s exec. order expands worker’s compensation coverage to 80K workers who are now eligible for benefits if they contract COVID-19 or are quarantined. Details:  https://t.co/R03toP28LO

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s press briefing on COVID-19 in North Dakota.  https://t.co/upAnzCqYaW

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: With 171 more test results in, ND has 3 new confirmed cases of COVID-19, bringing our total to 39, with 8 hospitalizations.  Please continue to stay home, avoid non-essential trips and keep physical distance. It's everyone's responsibility to be #NDSmart and help slow the spread.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We're continuing to take your input and explore ways to better serve North Dakotans through this COVID-19 crisis.   Today the Bank of North Dakota announced that student loan borrowers may request to defer payments for six months. Learn more & opt in here:  https://t.co/ang3f6VZzC

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Tune in to today’s COVID-19 press briefing.  https://t.co/wdhvpgZIP5

tweet: Health care providers have been collecting specimens for COVID-19 testing from almost all areas of North Dakota. These specimens are then tested at a state or private lab. This map breaks down completed tests by county.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We've launched a rapid planning process to develop operating guidelines to ensure that child care is available for health care and other essential workers through the COVID-19 crisis. (1/3)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The NDDoH lab confirmed 2 new cases of COVID-19 in ND today.  It's important to note these tests have a lag time — results will not be an immediate indicator of how well we're practicing #socialdistancing. Now is not the time to be complacent. We’ve got to be vigilant. #COVID19ND

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: No new positive cases of COVID-19 from the most recent @NDDOH report. North Dakota's confirmed positive cases remains at 28.  Stay home, avoid non-essential trips and practice social distancing. It's everyone's responsibility to be #NDSmart and help slow the spread. #COVID19ND

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: To expand the availability of COVID-19 testing, I signed an executive order authorizing licensed pharmacists to administer tests in collaboration with @NDDOH. It also streamlines the process for essential prescription medication refills during this crisis.  https://t.co/RcrlJauJ3v

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: With 231 tests conducted so far today, 2 have been positive, bringing North Dakota's confirmed positive cases of COVID-19 to 28.  Stay home, avoid non-essential trips and practice social distancing. Be #NDSmart and help slow the spread. #COVID19ND.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: During a crisis, misinformation is often our greatest enemy. New information regarding COVID-19 remains dynamic and constantly changing. Given the importance and fluidity of this situation it is vital that we circulate only factual reports and refrain from rumor.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: ND has now confirmed 20 total positive tests for COVID-19.   A reminder that bars, restaurants, rec facilities & entertainment venues will close to on-site patrons at noon today until April 6. Continue practicing social distancing and help slow the spread. #COVID19ND #NDSmart.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today I signed an executive order directing bars, restaurants, recreational facilities and entertainment venues to close to on-site patrons tomorrow at noon until April 6 to slow the spread of COVID-19. Read more:  https://t.co/9b8FGpvyyL

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: For North Dakota businesses feeling the effects of COVID-19, @CommerceND has assembled important information pertaining to both state and federal resources for businesses and communities affected economically.  Explore available resources:  https://t.co/ESMJRutcuj

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: North Dakota has now confirmed 15 total positive tests for COVID-19. It's critically important that you stay home when you're sick and practice social distancing.  Follow the @NDDOH & visit  https://t.co/pY1odUUdzg to stay up to date with the latest info.  https://t.co/s0XpTedO1E

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic can create feelings of fear and anxiety. @NorthDakotaBH put together helpful resources for managing your well-being along with your friends, family and community. #BehavioralHealthIsHealth  https://t.co/vaKWPX6bzs

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Today we confirmed our first 2 cases of community transmission of COVID-19, bringing our total to 7 positive cases in ND.  Follow the @NDDOH and visit  https://t.co/pY1odUUdzg for the latest information.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: With North Dakota's first confirmed cases of community transmission of COVID-19, @NDDOH Field Medical Officer Joan Connell helps explain what that means and how to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus. Tune into a news conference on  https://t.co/UOsJh4AhCr now for more.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: .@NDDOH confirmed a new case of COVID-19 in Morton County, which is the first confirmed case of community spread of the disease in ND.   It’s critically important to practice social distancing and stay home when you’re sick, even if it’s minor.   https://t.co/6l56uWljK0

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: .@NDDOH confirmed two new cases of COVID-19 tonight in Burleigh County, for a total of 5 positive cases in ND.  For questions related to COVID-19, you can call 1-866-207-2880 daily from 7am-10pm. For medical advice, contact your health care provider.  https://t.co/KuzF9JagpX  https://t.co/EHpY1Do2j5

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: WATCH: Press conference with @NDDOH to discuss two additional positive cases of COVID-19 in North Dakota and the importance of social distancing to slow the spread of coronavirus.  https://t.co/4FAenR96LV

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The @NDDOH confirmed two additional cases of COVID-19 in residents from Cass & Ward counties.   This increase in cases underscores the importance of exercising personal responsibility & following the CDC & White House recommendations for social distancing.  https://t.co/OLBFagYiPO

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: News about COVID-19 is everywhere and concerns can result in children feeling anxious. As you take steps to protect your physical health, remember to address your family's behavioral health needs.  Visit  https://t.co/g73kiSAN3H for resources to guide your family's conversation.  https://t.co/ERd1jZl9NT

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Our Unified Command is working with state, local & tribal partners to slow and mitigate the spread of COVID-19 and protect our citizens. We’ll continue to keep you informed as the situation develops.   Questions? Visit  https://t.co/pY1odUUdzg or call @NDDoH at 1-866-207-2880.  https://t.co/cSouNMinld

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The decision was made in an effort to reduce the rate of infection and allow time to gather more data, better assess testing and treatment capabilities and plan for education in the event of an extended COVID-19 pandemic. The situation will be reassessed at the end of the week.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: To slow the spread of COVID-19 and protect our citizens, public and private schools will be closed March 16-20. We want to work through the situation, gain understanding and make sure we’re driven by data and solid strategies.  https://t.co/wLsCu7D2gP

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Happening now: press conference about K-12 school closures related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch live:  https://t.co/8DsQb5VMBD

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We have announced the declaration of a state of emergency for North Dakota in response to COVID-19 and issued guidance to K-12 schools. Watch the press conference on  https://t.co/UOsJh4AhCr #coronavirus  https://t.co/NLp6Dk3Xoy

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Tonight, @NDDOH confirmed North Dakota's first presumptive case of COVID-19 in a Ward County resident. We have been planning and preparing for this since January, and our top priority is your health, safety and well-being.  https://t.co/wTwYqYevMl

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Every North Dakotan has a role to play in reducing the spread of COVID-19. The @WhiteHouse and @CDCgov have provided state, local, tribal and community leaders with the latest helpful actions for all Americans. Learn more here:  https://t.co/MDOlAO46Hg  https://t.co/nntm8J2tQT

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The ND Emergency Commission voted today to accept up to $6 million in federal funds to contain & mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Grateful to Congress and @POTUS for approving $8.3 billion for #coronavirus preparedness, prevention & treatment efforts.  https://t.co/Hlkm8nXpq2

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Our highest priority is the health, safety and well-being of all North Dakotans, and that especially includes our seniors and individuals with serious chronic medical conditions who are among the most vulnerable to COVID-19. Read about steps you can take:  https://t.co/FNRzSvXW21

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Over the weekend, @NDDOH tested four individuals for COVID-19, and all tests came back negative. Learn more:  https://t.co/TM0CT0qx7i  While we have not had a case in ND, everyone has a role to play in reducing the spread of COVID-19. Learn what you can do:  https://t.co/XFYwB2V86T

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Participated with fellow governors in a briefing call from @VP Pence and @SecAzar regarding the response to COVID-19.   We'll provide an update on the state's preparations at a press conference at 2:00 p.m. tomorrow, which will be streamed live at:  https://t.co/Kb9g2sZa5A.  https://t.co/e5qmphhqKv

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We are actively monitoring the COVID-19 situation with @NDDOH and taking all appropriate measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus and fine-tune response plans. The health, safety and well-being of our citizens remains our top priority. Read more:  https://t.co/pQp21CDfNM
